# Reproducible Research: Peer Assessment 1
## By Mike Vargas


### Load the data from a local file and save a version without the NAs
```{r}
getData<-read.csv("activity.csv", colClasses=c('numeric','Date','numeric'))
goodData<-na.omit(getData)
```
### Histogram of steps taken per day
```{r}
daySteps<-aggregate(goodData$steps, by=list(goodData$date), sum)
hist(daySteps$x, breaks=20, xlab="Steps", ylab="Days")
```


### Mean and Median steps per day

```{r}
mean(daySteps$x)
median(daySteps$x)
```

### What is the average daily activity pattern?
```{r}
intSteps<-aggregate(goodData$steps, by=list(goodData$interval), mean)
plot.ts(intSteps$x, type="l", xlab="Series", ylab="Avg Steps")
```


### The interval period with the most steps
```{r}
y<-max(intSteps$x)
z<-intSteps[intSteps['x']==y]
print(z[1])
```

## Imputing missing values
###look for missing data in Steps
```{r}
checkCol <- getData$steps
print(length(checkCol[is.na(checkCol)]))
```
